official-title.#text: To amend the Public Health Service Act to improve the health of children and help better understand and enhance awareness about unexpected sudden death in early life.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 9, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sudden Unexpected Death Data Enhancement and Awareness Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The

header.#text: Stillbirth and sudden deaths in the young
Stillbirth and sudden deaths in the young

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall continue to carry out activities of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: relating to stillbirth, including the following:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for surveillance efforts to collect thorough, complete, and high-quality epidemiologic information on stillbirths, including through the utilization of existing surveillance systems (including the National Vital Statistics System (NVSS) and other appropriately equipped birth defects surveillance programs).

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with qualified individuals and organizations determined appropriate by the
, to include representatives of health and advocacy organizations, State and local governments, public health officials, and health researchers, shall—

text.#text: The
provide for the continued development and dissemination of a standard protocol for stillbirth data collection and surveillance; and
not less than every 5 years, review and, as appropriate, update such protocol.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with qualified individuals and organizations determined appropriate by the
, to include representatives of health professional organizations, shall—

text.#text: The

upon the enactment of this section, and not less than every 5 years thereafter, review existing guidelines for increasing and improving the quality and completeness of postmortem stillbirth evaluation and related data collection, including conducting and reimbursing autopsies, placental histopathology, and cytogenetic testing; and
develop strategies for implementing such guidelines and addressing any barriers to implementation of such guidelines.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall continue to carry out activities of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: relating to sudden unexpected infant death (SUID), including the following:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for surveillance efforts to gather sociodemographic, death scene investigation, clinical history, and autopsy information on SUID cases through the review of existing records on SUID, including through the utilization of existing surveillance systems (including the national child death review case reporting system and SUID case registries).

text.#text: The
provide for the continued development and dissemination of a standard protocol for SUID data reporting and surveillance; and
not less than every 5 years, review and, as appropriate, update such protocol.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with qualified individuals and organizations determined appropriate by the
, to include representatives of health and advocacy organizations, State and local governments, and public health officials, shall—

text.#text: The
Collecting thorough, complete, and high-quality death scene investigation data, clinical history, and autopsy findings.
Collecting standardized information about the environmental and medical circumstances of death (including the sleep environment and quality of the death scene investigation).

Supporting multidisciplinary infant death reviews, such as those performed by child death review committees, to collect and review the information and classify and characterize SUID using a standardized classification system.
Facilitating the sharing of information to improve the public reporting of surveillance and vital statistics describing the epidemiology of SUID.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall seek to accomplish the following goals:

text.#text: In carrying out activities under this subsection, the
provide for the continued dissemination of a standard death scene investigation protocol; and
not less than every 5 years, review and, as appropriate, update such protocol.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with forensic pathologists, medical examiners, coroners, medicolegal death scene investigators, law enforcement personnel, emergency medical technicians and paramedics, public health agencies, and other individuals and organizations determined appropriate by the

text.#text: The
the current and past medical history of the infant;
family medical history;
the circumstances surrounding the death, including any suspicious circumstances;
the sleep position and sleep environment of the infant; and
any accidental or environmental factors associated with death.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: relating to sudden unexpected death in childhood (SUDC), including the following:

text.#text: The

header.#text: Sudden unexplained death in childhood activities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall provide for surveillance efforts to gather sociodemographic, death scene investigation, clinical history, and autopsy information on SUDC cases through the review of existing records on SUDC, including through the utilization of existing surveillance systems (including the Sudden Death in the Young Registry).

text.#text: the results of the evaluation under
a description of any activities that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: relating to stillbirth, SUID, or SUDC; and

text.#text: are being carried out by the
are in addition to the activities being carried out pursuant to this section.
In this section:

quote.#tail: means a spontaneous fetal death that—

text.#text: The term
occurs at 20 or more weeks gestation; or
if the age of the fetus is not known, involves a fetus weighing 350 grams or more.

quote.#tail: mean the death of an infant less than 1 year of age—

text.#text: The terms
which occurs suddenly and unexpectedly; and
whose cause—
is not immediately obvious prior to investigation; and
is either explained upon investigation or remains unexplained.

quote.#tail: mean the sudden death of a child 1 year of age or older which remains unexplained after a thorough case investigation that includes—

text.#text: The terms
a review of the clinical history and circumstances of death; and
performance of a complete autopsy with appropriate ancillary testing.
No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated for the purpose of carrying out this section, and this section shall be carried out using amounts otherwise available for such purpose.
